Posts.Content: C130sunshine wrote: First...I have just found this web site.....I have learned more from all of you then any of the "official" information web sites....so thank you.  Very short history...please bare with me I am new at this. I was diagnosed back in April 2008 while stationed in Korea.  After diagnosis I was sent to Hawaii for treatment.  Unfortunately I did not have easy access to computers.  My surgeon was great but I had problems with my oncologist.  I eventually got my self stationed in California.  Now I have a great oncologist.  I did not start chemo treatment until 16 Jun 2008.  Even though I am stage 1, my Oncotype DX was 42 (I am 39).  I am receiving Taxatere, Cytoxan, and Adriamycin all at once every 21 days for 6 treatments (I just finished treatment number 5).  Then I will start radiation. Here is my question:  I noticed after treatment number 3 my pupils are no longer the same size.  I have no other symptoms (no changes in eye sight, no headaches, no problems walking, etc).  I have had a MRI of the head and neck, CT of the neck and chest plus a spinal tap.  Everything has come up negative (they were first worried that I might also have brain cancer).  I have seen an Optometrist, Ophthalmologist, and a Neurologist.  No one can figure out why my pupils have changed or even if this is a permanent change.  Does anyone have any ideas?  Has anyone seen or heard of this? C130sunshine Dx 4/4/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Have Doctors stumped C130sunshine C130sunshine
